configuration.name: AIR_XHR
configuration.comment: For XHR architecture for Java implementation

object.name: blackberry.system
object.comment: The System object allows you to get access to system level functions and attributes of the Playbook device.
object.details: The System object is static; all of its functions and properties are used directly from the object.
object.example:
<script type="text/javascript">
  
  // See if we are in coverage 
  if (!blackberry.system.hasDataCoverage())
  {
      alert("you are not in coverage, we will attempt to send later");
  }
  else if ((blackberry.network == "GPRS") && (blackberry.system.hasCapability("network.wlan")))
  {
      if (confirm("You are in coverage, but it is a lot of data to send over GPRS, do you want to wait until you are connected to a WiFi hotspot before transmitting?"))
      {
          // Do Transmit
      }
      else
      {
         // Wait until later
      }
  }   
</script>

const.name: ALLOW
const.comment: Returned by hasPermission() indicating that the module requested is accessible.

const.name: DENY
const.comment: Returned by hasPermission() indicating that the module is not accessible.

const.name: PROMPT
const.comment: Returned by hasPermission() indicating that the user will be prompted when accessing the requested module.

func.name: hasPermission
func.comment: Determines the level of access to the requested module.

param.name: module
param.comment: which BlackBerry Widget Toolkit namespace or class to check for access. For example blackberry.system, blackberry.pim.Contact.

func.details: The possible return values: 0 - ALLOW 1 - DENY 2 - PROMPT 3 - NOT_SET

func.name: hasCapability
func.comment: This method will determine if the device is capable of the given service.
func.details:
hasCapability() returns true if the device is capable of the service; false otherwise.
The supported string values for 'capability' are:
input.keyboard.issuretype (returns if the user is currently using SureType), input.touch, media.audio.capture, media.video.capture, media.recording, location.gps, location.maps, storage.memorycard (checks for an EXTERNAL SD card only), network.bluetooth,
network.wlan (WLAN wireless family includes 802.11, 802.11a, 802.11b, 802.11g), network.3gpp (3GPP wireless family includes GPRS, EDGE, UMTS, GERAN, UTRAN, and GAN),
network.cdma (CDMA wireless family includes CDMA1x and EVDO), and network.iden.

func.name: hasDataCoverage
func.comment: Returns true if the device is in coverage, otherwise returns false. This can be used in conjunction with the blackberry.network property to find out what kind of coverage it is in.
func.details: Returns true if the PlayBook has either a Sapphire or WiFi connection active.

func.name: isMassStorageActive
func.comment: Returns whether USB MassStorage is active.
func.details: Always returns false on the PlayBook since Mass Storage Mode is not supported. All PlayBook memory is presented as a network share when connected by USB and is not blocked.

property.name: scriptApiVersion
property.comment: Returns the current version of the BlackBerry Widget Toolkit library being used.

property.name: softwareVersion
property.comment: Returns the current version of the operating system, for example, 1.0.0.0.

property.name: model
property.comment: Returns the model number of the Playbook.
